resp:

1. Identify the episodes by their production code, as each episode has a unique production code (101, 102, 103, ..., 109). The first episode should have a production code of "101".
2. Check which row in the table corresponds to the production code of the first episode ("101"). In this case, it's Row 1 (the pilot episode).
3. Examine the US viewers column for the selected row. The value for the US viewers of the pilot episode is 4.75 million.
4. Compare the US viewers of the pilot episode with the US viewers of other episodes in the table to determine if it has the highest viewership.
